name: EKE energy chain configurator
purpose: Quick online design of ready-to-connect energy chains for linear movement. With the energy chain configurator "e-chain expert", users can assemble individual ready-to-connect energy chain system in just a few steps.
product_description: Igus energy chains are a type of cable carrier system used to manage and protect cables and hoses in dynamic applications. They are designed and manufactured by the German company Igus, which specializes in the development of motion plastics for use in various industries. Igus energy chains are made up of a series of interconnected links that form a chain-like structure. They are typically made of igus self lubricating plastic materials from, and are lightweight and easy to install. The links are designed to move smoothly over one another, allowing for flexible movement of cables and hoses without tangling or snagging. Igus energy chains are used in a wide range of applications, from robotics and automation to cranes and construction equipment. They are particularly useful in applications where cables and hoses need to move with a machine or equipment, such as in CNC machines or material handling systems. Overall, Igus energy chains provide a durable and reliable solution for cable management, ensuring that cables and hoses are protected and organized while in motion. Energy chains (also called energy supply chains, e-chains, kabelschlepp) are mechanical machine elements. They are used to guide and protect lines for energy, data and signals that have to withstand the most diverse environmental influences. The decisive fact about cable guides is the symbiosis of the components moving against each other. They include cables, hoses, interior separation elements, strain relief devices and guide troughs. The materials used have to be optimally matched to each other so that maximum operating times and a long service life are achieved. Thanks to energy chains, downtime is avoided wherever energy in the form of electricity, gas, air or fluids is supplied to moving loads.
tool_description: energy chain configurator: Quick online design of ready-to-connect energy chains. With the energy chain configurator "e-chain expert", users can assemble individual ready-to-connect energy chain system for linear movements in just a few steps. Quick and easy online design, Display price, service life and delivery time, Share the current processing status. Select cables or harnessed cables according to type and manufacturer or start with the fill weight. Step 1: Cable selection: If you know your exact cable filling start by selecting cables or assembled cables according to type and manufacturer. Start with the cable selection or Fill weight ¬– if you do not know your exact cable filling, but you can roughly indicate the fill weight. Step 2 Application parameters: The next step is to select the type of installation and enter the required speed and acceleration as well as the travel and environment of the application. Step 3: Selection of the energy chain: The optimum energy supply system is then determined and displayed with the price/m. In a first step, select your system and then a suitable series. Determine service life: The self-learning, automatic filling function determines the ideal energy chain for your selection, and the service life of the energy chain is calculated in double strokes. Step 4: Configure interior separation: Use this configurator to fill your energy chain quickly and easily. Download with parts list and 3D CAD model. Step 5: In the energy chain configurator you can optionally add accessories such as mounting brackets. Step 6 add optional trough. Step 7 add optional strain relief. Step 8 Result: Here you will get an overview of all components, a total price and the estimated delivery time. To transfer to the shopping cart, simply click on "Add to cart". Furthermore, you can download a free 3D CAD model of the selected energy chain, save the configuration and download the drawing and parts list as a PDF.

name: DSE Lead screw motor expert
purpose: Provide users with a way to find and configure suitable components for linear drive solutions.
product_description: Provide users with a way to find and configure suitable components for linear drive solutions.
tool_description: The igus lead screw motor is a specialized product designed to convert rotational movement into linear movement, ideal for use in a variety of drive technology applications. This product is composed of an electrical (stepper) motor combined with a permanently fixed lead screw that drives a nut. The motor has a mechanically fixed cavity that receives the lead screw, with a connection made by a combination of screws and adhesive. The igus lead screw motor has advantages over other linear actuators due to its exceptional compactness and cost-effectiveness. It is engineered to handle greater axial forces than conventional electrical motors and has a performance range of NEMA11 to 23 sizes with feed forces of up to 500N, depending on the pitch of the lead screw. The maximum travel speed is 0.4m/s, and typical positioning accuracy can reach up to 0.1mm. The igus lead screw motor system is environmentally conscious, operating without lubrication and reducing maintenance requirements. This product is ideal for applic tions with modest demands for relevant design parameters such as load, positioning accuracy, dynamics, travel speed, and cycle rate. The igus lead screw motor system offers a reliable, efficient, and cost-effective solution for linear drive technology. Its compact design and environmental considerations make it a practical choice for a wide range of industrial applications, including office equipment, medical technology, and compact machines. With its combination of simplicity, reliability, and efficiency, the igus lead screw motor/drive system provides a versatile and practical solution for drive technology applications. Configurator description: The igus lead screw motor product configurator is a three-step tool designed to simplify the selection process for our customers. Step 1 allows users to select one of four designs of nuts and specify operating conditions, such as stroke length, dynamic axial force, feed rate in m/s, and duty cycle. Step 2 provides a list of suitable products based on the user's spe ifications, with available filters for motor NEMA sizes, step resolution, supplied voltage, and encoder availability. Each product listing includes information on screw thread, nut length, lifetime calculation, and price, with the ability to sort and view a visual representation of the product. In Step 3, users can view a detailed visualization of the selected product, including information on motor installation size, holding torque, nominal current, nut type and material, lead screw thread type, diameter, pitch, material, tolerances, and assembly. The user can also check suitability information, dimensions, specific motor data, and download data sheet, catalogue and EPLAN files. Ensuring that tolerances are maintained is crucial to the safe and reliable operation of our lead screw motors. To this end, we take great care to package all components securely to ensure that they are not subject to any damage during shipping. This guarantees that the lead screw motor will arrive at its destination in perfect condi ion, ready to provide the precise and efficient performance that our customers have come to expect from igus products.

name: DGE drylin® lead screw drive expert
purpose: Find and configure the right lead screw and nut combination for users application requirements and receive an estimated service lifetime.
product_description: dryspin high helix thread product range offers a wide range of different lead screw nuts and lead screw models in various dimensions. The range of dryspin® high helix threads includes diameters from 4 to 20mm and pitches from 2.4 to 100mm. Due to the diversity of the product range, the dryspin thread geometry is conceivable in almost all applications. lead screw drives can replace conventional ball screw drives. It is necessary to adhere to the application parameters (axial load, rotation speed, etc.) and reach the required positioning accuracy. Our lead screw drive expert offers optimal help for choosing the perfect lead screw system for every application. advantages of dryspin technology compared to conventional lead screw drives: Higher efficiencies, Quiet and low-vibration operation, 30% longer service life due to asymmetry, Up to 25% less wear, Higher efficiency. Our drylin lead screw nuts are up to 50.9% more cost-effective than metal lead screw nuts. Also up to 69% more cost-effective compared to comparable plastic lead screw nuts and up to 50% more cost-effective compared to ball screw systems. Self-locking means that lead screw nuts and lead screws cannot be moved without the application of external force. It has to do with the pitch and coefficient of friction. Lead screw nuts that are made of tribologically optimised iglidur® materials can be used in temperature ranges between -20°C and +150°C. Our lead screw support blocks are available in thread sizes of 6-24mm. Choice of mounting: plain bearings or, with higher dynamics, ball bearings (BB). All lead screw support blocks, like the matching lead screw clamp rings, are supplied in hard anodised aluminium. In addition to the correct choice of material for the lead screw nut, a preload mechanism against unwanted bearing clearance has proven to be an effective measure in practice. For trapezoidal threads and dryspin® high helix threads, anti backlash, zero backlash & low clearance versions with preload of the thread nut are available. It is no secret that igus is an advocate of non-lubrication of bearings. Simply put, lubrication is not required for igus products. We often hear from customers the recurring question: “Can I use WD-40 or another lubricant to lubricate my bearing? ” The special type of the JGRM threaded nut, in combination with a stainless steel plate, allows the accommodation of static loads of up to 6 MPa. The most important thing to remember when installing a polymer flange lead screw nut is not to exceed the maximum tightening torque of 2.5Nm. It is also recommended to secure the fastening screws with a third medium, e.g. a semi permanent thread locking glue. When installing a cylindrical lead screw nut made of polymeric, axial and radial locking is necessary. An option for radial locking is the use of set screws. Axial fastening through a sheet metal ring possible. In addition to the correct choice of material, a preloading mechanism has proven to be an effective measure to reduce unwanted axial clearance. For our dryspin® high helix threads and trapezoidal threads there are three versions with preload: Zero-Backlash, Low-Clearance and AB lead screw nut. Here you will find all the advantages and assembly instructions for our clearance-reduced lead screw nuts. Single-start lead screws consist of only one thread. This means that the distance between the flanks, marked by pitch, is also the linear travel (lead) in millimeters per revolution of the lead screw. If another thread is added, the lead screw reaches twice the stroke (2x pitch) with one revolution. The calculation for the linear travel always remains the same depending on the number of threads, only the pitch of a single thread differs. This procedure can also be applied to our multi-start dryspin® high helix lead. Our lead screw nuts are available in 6 different materials: iglidur® J, iglidur® 350, iglidur® R, iglidur® A180, iglidur® J200, iglidur® E7 and iglidur® W300. The differences and advantages of the individual materials can be found here: iglidur® J, iglidur® W300, iglidur® A180, iglidur® J350, iglidur® E7, iglidur® J200, iglidur® R. Apart from the pitch accuracy of 0.1 to 300mm, customer-specific tolerances are implemented in the end machining of the lead screws and the machining of nuts. According to DIN 103, tolerance class 7e.
tool_description: The drylin® lead screw drive expert helps engineers and all users interested in finding, planning, configuring and purchasing a lead screw module consisting of a spindle and a nut for linear movement. The configurator allows the configuration of suitable product combinations according to users’ application parameters and outputs price, delivery time, required drive force and estimated system lifetime. Users can find and order the suitable configurations or request a quote in four simple steps: In step 1 users choose the type and design of the nut: Cylindrical spanner flat, Cylindrical anti-backlash, Cylindrical injection moulding, Cylindrical heavy duty, Cylindrical heavy duty stainless steel, Flange spanner flat, Flange anti-backlash, Flange zero-backlash, Flange preload, Flange injection moulding. Also users can define the Screw threads: Trapezoidal thread, Metric thread, dryspin® high helix thread and the thread size and thread direction together with the spindle material and the nut material. In Step 2 users can define their system requirements and select from different environmental options like operating temperature, humidity or FDA requirements. The mounting options are defined with the lead screw support selections and dynamic parameters can be defined: dynamic axial force in Newton, Stroke length in millimeters, feed rate in meters per minute, rotational speed in rounds per minute and duty cycle as percentage of 10 minutes duty time. In step 3 users find a list of suitable configurations to compare and choose from. Each item in the list displays the estimated service lifetime of one configuration together with the required torque, information about potential noise emissions, screw material, thread, dimensions and nut material and the price per piece. Users can select the desired item from the list and move to step 4 to find a summary of the configuration with details about the screw and the nut article they chose. The price and delivery time is displayed per article and as total price. Users can select a quantity fort configurations they need and transfer it to the shopping cart to place an order or to request a quote.

name: DHC drylin® roller bearing configurator
purpose: Find a suitable configuration of drylin W roller bearings and guide rails for a given manually driven application.
product_description: igus offers linear systems that consist of guide rails and bearings that travel on these rails. There are different linear guide system series available. The series drylin W allows the use of roller bearings also referred to as hybrid roller bearings. These bearings are equipped self lubricating gliding elements made from igldur materials in combination with a roller component. The roller component drastically reduces friction and thus allows a very light manual operation with very low required drive force. The drylin W roller bearings are not suited for mechanical or motoric drives. Movement by hand is the purpose for application of roller bearings for example for sliding doors for compartments or machines, adjustable control panels that can be moved to different locations on a rail, machine parts that can be moved manually for example to do maintenance, or other linear movements of objects that should be easily performed by hand. A linear system with roller bearings consists of two rails or one double rail and four roller bearings. 2 bearings on one rail and two on the other rail forming a rectangle. The bearings are connected through a plate, table or similar construction. Together with the connecting plate or table the system is called a complete carriage. There are different designs of drylin roller bearings with one or two rollers build in and with different mounting angles of the rollers inside the bearing. Depending on the application it should work in special combinations of bearings and guide rails are required and special layouts of rails and bearing mounting angels are required. The best suited layout and the suitability of the products itself depend on the mass that should be moved, center of mass offset, carriage length, carriage width, rail distance, system orientation (horizontal or lateral) and the drive point offset. The roller component of a roller bearing can be equipped with a roller that spins on a simple axis or it can be a roller equipped with a ball bearing for even less friction. Roller bearings have a limited lifetime of maximum 200 km. For longer lifetimes and installations with mechanical or electric drive and or high loads pure gliding bearings without rollers from drylin W, drylin T, drylin R, drylin N or drlin T should be considered, that are not part of this configurator. It is important to understand, that roller bearings are suited for systems that are are manually operated, driven, or otherwise moved.
tool_description: The drylin® roller bearing configurator helps engineers and all users interested in planning and purchasing a linear guide system with drylin roller bearings for manual operation to find the best suited guides and roller bearing article combination and layout for their application. The configurator shows suitable configurations according to users’ application parameters together with price, delivery time, required drive force and system lifetime. Users can find and order the suitable configurations or request a quote in three simple steps: In step 1 users choose the system type with two single rails and 4 bearings, one double rail with 4 bearings or one double rail with a complete carriage that includes 4 bearings mounted on a connection plate. Rail distance, carriage length and rail length can be defined. System orientation horizontal or lateral can be selected. The load is defined as weight force in Newton (N) together with the offset of the center of mass in x, y and z direction from the center of the 4 bearings. The drive point offset y and z from the center of the 4 bearings can be defined. These application parameters are used to find suitable roller bearing and rails combinations together with suitable layouts and mounting angels of the component that are displayed as a list in step 2. The list displays for each result article numbers, housing material, type of roller bearing (ball bearing or standard), required drive force, estimated service lifetime and price. The results are grouped by system layouts also referred to as arrangements. There are seven arrangements available from arrangement A to G each for specific use cases. Users can compare the results and reduce the number of results by filtering for housing material or type of roller bearing (standard or ball-bearing). Users can select a result item (configuration) in the list to display the configuration details in step 3. In step 3 users find additional information on the bearing and rail articles of the configuration like width, length height, sliding element material, housing material, roller axis type, article number, price, and delivery time together with information about the system arrangement including a schematic drawing. Users can select a quantity of configurations they need and transfer it to the shopping cart to place an order or to request a quote.

name: DMX drylin® motor expert
purpose: Purchase advice for electric motors and motor gearbox combinations
product_description: igus offers a wide range of electric motors. Electric motors are used to drive linear movement, rotational movement, spindles, shafts, vehicles, cogs, propellers, wheels, gears, belts, actuators, or other mechanical systems that require electric drives. Igus offers different type of electric motors: stepper motors, DC motors, brushless DC motors also called BLDC or EC motors. These motors exist in many different sizes and each with individual power characteristics. Sizes are often referred to as NEMA size (NEMA 11, NEMA 17, NEMA 23, NEMA 24, NEMA 34) for different flange dimensions and measured in millimeter from 11 mm up to 86 mm. the pin diameter of the motor shaft is measured in millimeters from 4 mm up to 14 mm. Power characteristics are defined by the torque a motor can deliver at a given speed. Torque is measured in Newton meter (Nm), speed is measured in rounds per minute (rpm). The duty cycle is also influencing the suitability of a motor. Certain torque and speed ratios require an additional gearbox to match users’ application requirements and thus be suitable. Gearboxes are especially needed, when high amounts of torque are required at low speed. Motors can be equipped with different kinds of connectors like metric connectors, stranded wires, Flat connector, JST connector, Connector M12, M17 connector, molex connector.
tool_description: The drylin® motor expert helps engineers and all users interested in purchasing electric motors to find the right igus motor (or motor and gearbox combination) for their application, add optional accessories and order the articles or request a quote for the articles in three simple steps: In the first step (step 1) users can input the speed, torque, and duty cycle requirements of their application. In step 2 the configurator presents a list of suitable motors and motor-gearbox combinations specifically matching the requirements users have entered in step 1. Users can compare the motors in the list by price, motor workload, type of motor, size, connectors, features like hall, encoder, brake, and what kind of gearbox ratio is applied. They can reduce the result list by filtering for certain characteristics: motor types: EC/BLDC motors, DC motors Stepper motors, Gearbox ratios or items without gearboxes, Motors specifically designed for connection with a spindle, specific Shaft diameters, specific Flange diameters, holding torque, voltage, connection, and connectors, features like hall, encoder or brake, the IP-class for the motor housing which defines the dust and water resistance. With the help of the list of suitable motors users can select individual items and display a detailed description for each motor or motor gearbox-combination in step 3. The detailed description in step 3 contains additional technical details about the motor: nominal voltage, nominal current, rated speed, rated torque, CE-guidelines, motor brake, hall, motor encoder, motor connection, protection class motor housing. It also contains extra information on the gearbox if part of the offering: general properties like protection class, lubrication needs, gearbox ratio, nominal output torque maximum drive speed at operating temperature. A list of download links is offered in step 3: Users can download technical data sheets and EPLAN P8 macro. Optional accessories are offered in step 3 in form of connection kits that contain the electric connection cables that are exactly fitting the currently selected motor article. Each article in the step 3 is displayed with its individual price, estimated delivery time. When users find the articles suitable for their needs they can choose the quantity and transfer the motor and gearbox articles to the shopping cart in order to place an order or to request a quotation.
